title: Stocks to Watch Today: Swiggy, Akzo Nobel, Dilip Buildcon, HCL Tech, Torrent Power, Bajaj Electricals, VMS TMT, Ceinsys Tech in focus on 24 September
content: Let's catch up on the latest news from the stock market. From significant investments to major deals, order wins, appointments, and acquisitions, here’s a quick look at which stocks will be in focus in today's trade: Quarterly Earnings Sudarshan Chemical Industries Q1 (Consolidated YoY) Profit soars 87% to Rs 55 crore Vs Rs 29.4 crore Revenue zooms 296% to Rs 2,506.9 crore Vs Rs 633.6 crore Stocks to Watch Swiggy The Board has approved the sale of 10 equity shares and 1,63,990 Series D Compulsorily Convertible Preference Shares (CCPS) held by the company in Roppen Transportation Services (Rapido) to Netherlands-based MIH Investments One B.V. (owned by the Prosus group), for Rs 1,968 crore. MIH India Food Holdings B.V. is a public shareholder in Swiggy, holding a 23.31% stake as of June 2025. Further, the Board approved the sale of 35,958 Series D CCPS held by the company in Rapido to Setu AIF Trust (part of WestBridge Capital), for Rs 431.5 crore. Additionally, the Board approved the sale and transfer of the company’s quick commerce business under the brand Instamart to Swiggy Instamart, an indirect step-down wholly-owned subsidiary of the company, as a going concern through a slump sale. Akzo Nobel India Promoter Imperial Chemical Industries is likely to sell up to a 5% stake in Akzo Nobel via block deals, with an offer size of Rs 742.7 crore and a floor price of Rs 3,261.8 per share, reports CNBC-TV18 quoting sources. Dilip Buildcon The company, through DBL-PSP JV, has been declared as L-1 bidder for the project worth Rs 1,115.37 crore by the Kerala Industrial Corridor Development Corporation. The project involves design, construction, testing, commissioning, and operation & maintenance of infrastructure works at Pudussery Central & Kannambra of Palakkad Node in Kerala on an EPC basis. HCL Technologies The global technology company has renewed its long-standing digital transformation agreement with the Sweden-based commercial vehicle manufacturer, for AI-powered digital foundation services. Torrent Power The company has acquired 11.95 lakh equity shares (49% stake) of Newzone India (NZIPL) and 30 lakh equity shares (100% stake) of Newzone Power Projects (NZPPPL), the holding company of NZIPL, from the Sarawagi Family and related HUFs for Rs 211 crore. NZPPPL already holds a 51% stake in NZIPL. Bajaj Electricals The Board has approved the acquisition of the ‘Morphy Richards’ brand and related intellectual property rights for Rs 146 crore in the territories of India, Nepal, Bhutan, Bangladesh, the Maldives, and Sri Lanka, from Glen Electric (part of the Glen Dimplex Group, Ireland). Puravankara Deepak Rastogi has resigned as Group CFO and Key Managerial Personnel of the company, effective September 23. Further, Niraj Kumar Gautam has been elevated from the position of Deputy CFO to CFO of the company, effective September 24. VIP Industries Neetu Kashiramka has resigned as Managing Director (MD) of the company, effective September 23, and will continue in the employment of the company until October 31, 2025. However, the Board has appointed Atul Jain as MD, effective September 23, for a period of 5 consecutive years. Gandhar Oil Refinery (India) The company intends to terminate all existing licenses of the joint venture company Texol Oils FZC and the joint venture agreement entered into with the joint venture partner ESPE Oils FZC, and to close/wind up the joint venture company Texol Oils FZC. The company, as a corporate shareholder, holds 50% shares of Texol Oils FZC, which had received a commercial license from the Hamriyah Free Zone Authority, Sharjah. Poly Medicure The company, through its subsidiary RisoR Holdings B.V. in the Netherlands, has completed the acquisition of ordinary shares of Pendracare Holdings B.V. and Wellinq Medical B.V. (PendraCare Group). With this, the company now owns 90% of the economic rights in the PendraCare Group, and both the companies – Wellinq Medical B.V. and PendraCare Holding B.V. – now become step-down subsidiaries of Poly Medicure. Torrent Pharmaceuticals The Competition Commission of South Africa has granted its approval for the acquisition of a controlling stake in JB Chemicals & Pharmaceuticals from KKR by the company. Lemon Tree Hotels The company has signed two new properties – Keys Prima by Lemon Tree Hotels, Varanasi, and Keys Select by Lemon Tree Hotels, Rewa. Ceinsys Tech Ceinsys Tech has received a Letter of Award (LoA) from the Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) for the appointment of an agency for upgradation and procurement of ESRI ArcGIS Software Products Enterprise Agreement. The order, worth Rs 15.95 crore, is for 4 years, including license delivery and operation & maintenance support after license activation. Bulk Deals Sammaan Capital Plutus Wealth Management sold 1.16 crore shares in the company (1.4% stake) at Rs 137.26 per share, valued at Rs 159.2 crore. Parth Electricals & Engineering India Max Investment Fund offloaded 1 lakh shares in Parth Electricals & Engineering at Rs 225 per share. Wheels India HDFC Mutual Fund acquired 1,27,940 shares in Wheels India at Rs 809 per share. Block Deals Energy Infrastructure Trust Sponsor Rapid Holdings 2, which is a part of Brookfield Asset Management, offloaded 3.61 crore units (equivalent to 5.4% stake) in Energy Infrastructure Trust at Rs 82 per unit, amounting to Rs 296.43 crore. This was in addition to the 25.4% stake sold last week by the sponsor for Rs 1,382.7 crore. The said 5.4 percent units were bought by Neo Infra Income Opportunities Fund, B Arunkumar Capital & Credit Services, Pico Capital, and Neo Wealth Partners. NDR INVIT Trust Infra India Opportunities Parent sold 2.64 crore units (6.68% stake) in the InvIT at Rs 115 per unit, for Rs 304.2 crore to several investors including Tara Institutional India Alpha, Star Union Dai-Ichi Life Insurance Company, Tara Emerging Asia Liquid Fund, and Valuequest Investment Advisors. Ace investor Radhakishan Damani acquired 87 lakh units in the InvIT at the same price for Rs 100.05 crore, while Nishtha Jhunjhunwala Discretionary Trust, Aryavir Jhunjhunwala Discretionary Trust, and Aryaman Jhunjhunwala Discretionary Trust bought 86.75 lakh units for Rs 99.76 crore. title: Brookfield sells 5.4% stake in Energy Infrastructure Trust for Rs 296.4 crore, Plutus Wealth offloads 1.4% shares in Sammaan Capital
content: Sponsor Rapid Holdings 2, which is a part of the Brookfield Asset Management, sold 5.4 percent stake in Energy Infrastructure Trust for Rs 296.4 crore via open market transaction on September 23. Energy Infrastructure Trust units closed at Rs 82 on the BSE, down 0.27 percent. Rapid Holdings 2 has offloaded 3.61 crore units (equivalent to 5.4 percent stake) in the InvIT at Rs 82 per unit, amounting to Rs 296.43 crore. This was in addition to 25.4 percent stake sold last week by the sponsor for Rs 1,382.7 crore. The said 5.4 percent units were bought by Neo Infra Income Opportunities Fund, B Arunkumar Capital & Credit Services, Pico Capital, and Neo Wealth Partners. NDR INVIT Trust was also in focus on Tuesday, rising 4.35 percent to Rs 120. Infra India Opportunities Parent sold 2.64 crore units (6.68 percent stake) in the InvIT at Rs 115 per unit, for Rs 304.2 crore to several investors including Tara Institutional India Alpha, Star Union Dai-Ichi Life Insurance Company, Tara Emerging Asia Liquid Fund, and Valuequest Investment Advisors. Ace investor Radhakishan Damani acquired 87 lakh units in the InvIT at same price for Rs 100.05 crore, while Nishtha Jhunjhunwala Discretionary Trust, Aryavir Jhunjhunwala Discretionary Trust, and Aryaman Jhunjhunwala Discretionary Trust bought 86.75 lakh units for Rs 99.76 crore. Meanwhile, Sammaan Capital shares corrected sharply by 4.35 percent to Rs 135.02, may be after Plutus Wealth Management sold 1.16 crore shares in the company at Rs 137.26 per share, valued at Rs 159.2 crore. India Max Investment Fund offloaded 1 lakh shares in Parth Electricals & Engineering at Rs 225 per share, while HDFC Mutual Fund acquired 1,27,940 shares in Wheels India at Rs 809 per share. Promoter Anirudha Agrawal bought 3.95 lakh shares (0.6 percent stake) in Manak Aluminium Company at Rs 29.9 per share from Incredible Finesse. As of June 2025, Incredible Finesse was holding 17,01,619 shares (2.6 percent stake) in Manak.
summary_lexrank: Meanwhile, Sammaan Capital shares corrected sharply by 4.35 percent to Rs 135.02, may be after Plutus Wealth Management sold 1.16 crore shares in the company at Rs 137.26 per share, valued at Rs 159.2 crore.

title: Bank Nifty rebounds 500 pts from day's low, led by PSU banks; here are the triggers
content: Bank Nifty on Tuesday rebounded 500 points from the day’s low to hit an intraday high of 55,662, lifted by gains in select private and public sector lenders. The index snapped a two-day losing streak, closing 0.4 percent higher. Nifty PSU Bank also ended more than 1 percent up, reversing the previous session’s decline. AU Small Finance Bank was the top gainer in the Nifty Bank index, rising nearly 4 percent to Rs 731.65 on the NSE. The stock advanced after brokerage Motilal Oswal projected that the lender’s earnings would accelerate from the second half of FY26, with loan growth expected at a compounded 24 percent over FY26-28. The brokerage retained a “hold” rating with a median price target of Rs 773. IndusInd Bank gained after the lender appointed Viral Damania as chief financial officer, effective September 22. The move follows last month’s announcement of veteran banker Rajiv Anand taking charge as chief executive officer for a three-year term. Shares of State Bank of India ended 1.68 percent higher at Rs 869.60 after brokerage CLSA named the country’s largest lender among its top picks in the large-cap banking space. CLSA said SBI could achieve a market capitalisation of USD 100 billion within a year. Canara Bank closed 2.5 percent higher after its asset management arm, Canara Robeco Asset Management, filed an updated draft red herring prospectus with market regulator Sebi for an initial public offering. Axis Bank also contributed to the rebound after HSBC raised its price target to Rs 1,340 from Rs 1,270, reiterating a “buy” rating. The brokerage said earnings were at an inflection point. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: AU Small Finance Bank was the top gainer in the Nifty Bank index, rising nearly 4 percent to Rs 731.65 on the NSE.
summary_luhn: Shares of State Bank of India ended 1.68 percent higher at Rs 869.60 after brokerage CLSA named the country’s largest lender among its top picks in the large-cap banking space.
summary_lsa: Bank Nifty on Tuesday rebounded 500 points from the day’s low to hit an intraday high of 55,662, lifted by gains in select private and public sector lenders.
summary_textrank: The stock advanced after brokerage Motilal Oswal projected that the lender’s earnings would accelerate from the second half of FY26, with loan growth expected at a compounded 24 percent over FY26-28.

title: MRF shares rise 2.05%; among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of MRF gained 2.05% to trade at Rs 155,990.00 on Tuesday. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On the financial front, the consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 7,675.69 Crore, compared to Rs 7,074.82 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the June 2025 quarter was Rs 500.47 Crore, while in the previous quarter, it was Rs 512.11 Crore. The EPS for the same period stood at Rs 1,180.04, down from Rs 1,207.48 in March 2025. The company’s consolidated yearly revenue increased from Rs 25,169.21 Crore in 2024 to Rs 28,153.18 Crore in 2025. Net profit saw a decrease from Rs 2,081.23 Crore in 2024 to Rs 1,869.29 Crore in 2025. Similarly, the EPS decreased from Rs 4,907.24 in 2024 to Rs 4,407.51 in 2025. Key financial figures from the income statement include:Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 28,153 CroreRs 25,169 CroreRs 23,008 CroreRs 19,316 CroreRs 16,163 CroreOther IncomeRs 408 CroreRs 316 CroreRs 252 CroreRs 316 CroreRs 209 CroreTotal IncomeRs 28,561 CroreRs 25,486 CroreRs 23,261 CroreRs 19,633 CroreRs 16,373 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 25,722 CroreRs 22,345 CroreRs 21,872 CroreRs 18,471 CroreRs 14,361 CroreEBITRs 2,839 CroreRs 3,140 CroreRs 1,388 CroreRs 1,161 CroreRs 2,011 CroreInterestRs 360 CroreRs 353 CroreRs 319 CroreRs 253 CroreRs 274 CroreTaxRs 609 CroreRs 706 CroreRs 300 CroreRs 238 CroreRs 459 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,869 CroreRs 2,081 CroreRs 768 CroreRs 669 CroreRs 1,277 CroreThe company’s cash flow from operating activities for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 1,867 Crore, compared to Rs 3,300 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. The balance sheet shows that total assets stood at Rs 29,566 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, up from Rs 26,849 Crore in the previous year. Key ratios include a Debt to Equity ratio of 0.16 as of March 2025, compared to 0.12 in March 2024. The book value per share was Rs 43,604.86 for March 2025, up from Rs 39,394.25 for March 2024. MRF announced a final dividend of Rs 229 per share on May 7, 2025, with an effective date of July 18, 2025. Prior to that, an interim dividend of Rs 3 per share was announced on January 30, 2025, with an effective date of February 14, 2025. MRF is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 155,990.00, MRF has seen a gain of 2.05% from its previous close.

title: Indian Hotels Company shares fall 1.57% amid volume surge
content: Shares of Indian Hotels Company declined by 1.57% to Rs 757.30 in Tuesday's session, experiencing a surge in trading volume. The stock is a constituent of the NIFTY NEXT 50 index. On the financial front, Indian Hotels Company has shown significant growth. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 8,334.54 Crore, compared to Rs 6,768.75 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period was Rs 1,961.25 Crore, a substantial increase from Rs 1,201.59 Crore in the previous year. title: Vodafone Idea shares rise up to 7% ahead of SC hearing on AGR plea, extend rally to 38% in 3 weeks
content: The shares of Vodafone Idea surged nearly 7 percent on September 23. The stock has now rallied around 38 percent in September so far as investors awaited Supreme Court's decision on possible relief from some AGR dues. Vodafone Idea shares hit an intraday high of Rs 8.97 apiece, the highest level seen by the stock in more than seven months. The stock later pared some gains to trade around 5 percent higher at Rs 8.79 apiece. Supreme Court set to hear telco's AGR relief plea on Friday The Supreme Court is set to hear the telco's challenge to a fresh Rs 9,450-crore adjusted gross revenue (AGR) demand from the Centre on September 26 (Friday). Centre earlier told the apex court, "Not opposing Vodafone Idea plea, some solution is required, government is also an equity holder. Some solution may be required, subject to Supreme Court approval." The case stems from the Court's March 18, 2020 order, which upheld AGR dues up to FY17 as calculated by the Department of Telecommunications (DoT) and ruled out any reassessment by operators. The DoT had raised an extra demand on AGR dues worth Rs 2,774 crore for FY18-19. The petition said that out of the total Re 9,450 crore of demand, Rs 2,774 crore pertains to post-merger entity — Idea Group and Vodafone Idea — following their August 2018 consolidation, while Rs 5,675 crore relates to the pre-merger Vodafone Group’s liabilities. Vodafone Idea has contested the calculation, claiming that certain amounts have been added twice and need reconciliation. The company has asked for a recalculation of dues, starting from the pre-FY17 period. Citi calls Vodafone Idea a 'high-risk' buy Brokerage firm Citi called Vodafone Idea shares a 'high risk' buy, but set a target price of Rs 10 per share. This implies an upside potential of more than 19 percent from the stock’s previous closing price of Rs 8.39 apiece. According to the brokerage note cited by CNBC-TV18, Citi said the chances for a potential relief for the company have now increased. The shares of the debt-ridden telecom company had earlier seen significant plunge. The shares of the telecom company have surged around 47 percent in just six weeks after hitting a 52-week low of Rs 6.12 per shares, which they had hit in August this year. The stock is however still down around 25 percent from their 52-week high of Rs 11.94 apiece. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

summary_luhn: Supreme Court set to hear telco's AGR relief plea on Friday The Supreme Court is set to hear the telco's challenge to a fresh Rs 9,450-crore adjusted gross revenue (AGR) demand from the Centre on September 26 (Friday).
summary_lsa: The stock has now rallied around 38 percent in September so far as investors awaited Supreme Court's decision on possible relief from some AGR dues.

title: Subscribe for Solarworld Energy Solutions Ltd IPO; Geojit Financial Services
content: Geojit Financial Services, Solarworld Energy Solutions Ltd Solarworld Energy Solutions Ltd (SESL) is an integrated solar EPC and solutions provider incorporated in 2013, offering turnkey engineering, procurement, and construction services for solar power projects. It caters primarily to public sector undertakings (80% FY25 revenue) and industrial clients across India. Its business model includes rooftop and ground-mounted solar installations, along with operations and maintenance services. India’s solar EPC sector is witnessing rapid growth, fueled by supportive government policies such as the Approved List of Models and Manufacturers (ALMM), Basic Customs Duty (BCD), and the Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme for solar panel manufacturing. The country is projected to add 150–170 GW of solar capacity between FY26 and FY30, supported by growing energy demand and ongoing decarbonisation efforts. Valuation and Outlook At the upper price band of ₹351, SESL is valued at 39× FY25 PE, which appears reasonable given its robust financial performance. While relatively smaller size of revenue, the company’s asset-light model, low leverage, and consistent profitability underscore its operational strength. With backward integration, strategic expansion plans, and a focused EPC approach, SESL is well-positioned in India’s solar sector. Hence, we recommend a ‘Subscribe’ rating for long-term investors. title: Subscribe for Seshaasai Technologies Ltd IPO; Geojit Financial Services
content: Geojit Financial Services, Seshaasai Technologies Ltd Seshaasai Technologies Ltd. (STL), established in 1993 and headquartered in Mumbai, is a technology-driven provider of secure, integrated solutions. The company operates across multiple locations, delivering a wide range of offerings including payment solutions (debit, credit, prepaid, and transit cards), communication and fulfilment services, as well as IoT-based solutions. STL’s comprehensive portfolio caters to the varied requirements of clients across the banking, government, and enterprise sectors. The Indian payment cards market, valued at ₹9,071mn in FY20, expanded to ₹30,804mn by FY24. It is expected to nearly double, reaching ₹61,684mn by FY30, representing a CAGR of 12.3% over FY24–30. Valuation and Outlook Ongoing investments in automation, R&D, and capacity expansion position STL for scalable growth. Therefore, we assign a SUBSCRIBE rating for investors with a long-term perspective. title: Subscribe for Jaro Institute of Technology Management and Research Ltd IPO; Anand Rathi
content: Anand Rathi, Jaro Institute of Technology Management and Research Ltd Jaro Institute of Technology Management & Research Ltd is one of India’s online higher education and upskilling platform companies. Company market and facilitate delivery of a diversified range of online degree programs including D.B.A, MBA, M.Com., M.A., PGDM, M.C.A., M.Sc., B.Com., BCA, as well as cross-disciplinary certification courses, in partnership with 36 Partner Institutions, including 16 Tier-1 universities and institutions (which include 7 IIMs and 7 IITs) and 15 Tier-2 universities and institutions as of March 31, 2025. Since the establishment of their business in 2009 by Sanjay Namdeo Salunkhe, a first-generation entrepreneur and their Chairman and Managing Director with over 17 years of experience in the education sector, company have been one of the early movers in the online higher education and upskilling space. Despite being an entirely bootstrapped institution, they have achieved strong EBIDTA due to 16 years of in-depth understanding of the online higher education and upskilling sector. Valuation and Outlook At the upper price band company is valuing at P/E of 38.1x to its FY25 earnings, with EV/EBITDA of 24.8x and market cap of ₹ 19,719 million post issue of equity shares. We believe that the IPO is fully priced and recommend a “SubscribeLong Term” rating to the IPO. title: Hindustan Unilever shares fall 1.30%, hits intraday high of Rs 2,575.30
content: Shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading lower in Tuesday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 2,538.80, a 1.30% decrease from the previous close. The stock touched a day's high of Rs 2,575.30. On the financial front, the consolidated revenue for Hindustan Unilever for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 16,514 Crore, compared to Rs 15,670 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the same period was Rs 2,769 Crore, up from Rs 2,476 Crore in the previous quarter. The company's consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 63,121 Crore, compared to Rs 61,896 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 10,679 Crore, up from Rs 10,286 Crore in the previous year.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs.)202147,0288,00034.03202252,4468,88737.79202360,58010,14543.07202461,89610,28643.74202563,12110,67945.32Here is a summary of the key annual financial figures:QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPSJun 202415707.002614.0011.11Sep 202415926.002601.0011.03Dec 202415818.002988.0012.70Mar 202515670.002476.0010.48Jun 202516514.002769.0011.73The company announced several dividends. A final dividend of Rs 24 per share was announced on April 24, 2025, with an effective date of June 23, 2025. Earlier dividends include an interim dividend of Rs 19 per share and a special dividend of Rs 10 per share, both announced on October 10 and 11, 2024, respectively, with an effective date of November 6, 2024. Hindustan Unilever has also announced bonus issues in the past, including a 1:2 bonus ratio on September 30, 1991. The company also had a stock split on July 3, 2000, with the face value changing from Rs 10 to Rs 1. A Moneycontrol analysis, as of September 23, 2025, indicates bearish sentiment on the stock. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. A few of the corporate announcements made by Hindustan Unilever include announcements under Regulation 30 (LODR)-Newspaper Publication. At 1:30 pm, Hindustan Unilever was trading at Rs 2,538.80, a decrease of 1.30%.

title: 360 ONE WAM shares fall 2.05%; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of 360 ONE WAM declined by 2.05% to trade at Rs 1,028.90 on Tuesday. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Performance: Consolidated Quarterly Results: The company's consolidated quarterly revenue and net profit are as follows (in Rs Crore):QuarterRevenueNet ProfitEPSJun 2024Rs 849.34 CroreRs 243.74 Crore6.76Sep 2024Rs 862.76 CroreRs 245.49 Crore6.75Dec 2024Rs 759.83 CroreRs 276.47 Crore7.26Mar 2025Rs 820.77 CroreRs 249.60 Crore6.38Jun 2025Rs 911.46 CroreRs 284.67 Crore7.16The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 increased to Rs 911.46 Crore compared to Rs 820.77 Crore in March 2025. Similarly, the net profit for the June 2025 quarter stood at Rs 284.67 Crore, up from Rs 249.60 Crore in the previous quarter. title: Adani Enterprises shares rise 2.10% in Tuesday's trade
content: Adani Enterprises shares gained 2.10% to trade at Rs 2,684.60 on Tuesday. The stock's positive movement reflects a generally bullish sentiment. title: Vodafone Idea shares surge 5.84% amid high volume in today's session
content: Shares of Vodafone Idea were trading with a surge of 5.84% at Rs 8.88 in Tuesday's session, with high volume, volume surge, unusual volume, jump in volume. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Vodafone Idea Financials Vodafone Idea's consolidated financial performance shows a fluctuating trend in revenue and persistent net losses. The company's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 43,571.30 Crore, compared to Rs 42,651.70 Crore in the previous year. However, the company reported a net loss of Rs 27,385.20 Crore for the same period, against a net loss of Rs 31,232.90 Crore in the previous year. Earnings per share (EPS) stood at -Rs 4.01 for the year-ending March 2025, compared to -Rs 6.41 for the year-ending March 2024. The book value per share (BVPS) was -Rs 9.85 as of March 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio was -2.79 as of March 2025. Quarterly, the company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 11,022.50 Crore, compared to Rs 11,013.50 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The net loss for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 6,608.10 Crore, compared to Rs 7,168.10 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. Vodafone Idea - Key Financial Metrics (Consolidated)ParticularsMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Revenue (Rs Crore)43,571.3042,651.7042,177.2038,515.5041,952.20Net Profit (Rs Crore)-27,385.20-31,232.90-29,301.60-28,246.60-44,464.50EPS (Rs)-4.01-6.41-8.43-9.83-15.40BVPS (Rs)-9.85-20.78-15.28-19.29-13.30ROE (%)0.000.000.000.000.00Debt to Equity-2.79-1.99-0.18-3.08-4.12Corporate Actions Vodafone Idea has made several announcements, including intimations under Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, regarding orders passed under the Finance Act, 1994. The company also addressed rumours and clarified news articles related to AGR matters. The company had previously announced a final dividend of Rs 0.60 per share (6%) on April 28, 2016, with an effective date of September 22, 2016. Prior to that, a final dividend of Rs 0.60 per share (6%) was announced on April 28, 2015, with an effective date of September 18, 2015. In terms of rights issues, Vodafone Idea announced a rights issue on January 23, 2019, with an existing ratio of 38 and an offered ratio of 87, a face value of Rs 10, and a premium of Rs 3. The record date was April 2, 2019, and the ex-rights date was March 29, 2019, with a rights ratio of 87:38. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment for Vodafone Idea as of September 23, 2025. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 8.88, Vodafone Idea has seen a substantial surge in today's session amid high volume.
summary_lexrank: The debt-to-equity ratio was -2.79 as of March 2025.
summary_luhn: The company's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 43,571.30 Crore, compared to Rs 42,651.70 Crore in the previous year.
summary_lsa: With the stock's last traded price at Rs 8.88, Vodafone Idea has seen a substantial surge in today's session amid high volume.

title: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders shares fall 2.02% in today's trading
content: Shares of Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders declined by 2.02% to Rs 2,916.40 in Tuesday's session. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Performance: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders' consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the past few years. The company's consolidated revenue has increased steadily over the past five years. The revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 11,431.88 Crore, marking a significant increase compared to Rs 9,466.58 Crore in March 2024. This represents a growth of 20.76%. Net profit has also shown a substantial increase, reaching Rs 2,277.34 Crore for the year ending March 2025, compared to Rs 1,808.88 Crore in March 2024. This represents a growth of 25.90%. The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,625.59 Crore, marking an increase compared to Rs 2,357.02 Crore in June 2024. This represents a growth of 11.40%. Net profit has decreased to Rs 419.28 Crore for the quarter ending June 2025, compared to Rs 665.94 Crore in June 2024. Quarterly Consolidated Financials:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 2,357.02 CroreRs 2,756.83 CroreRs 3,143.62 CroreRs 3,174.41 CroreRs 2,625.59 CroreNet ProfitRs 665.94 CroreRs 552.76 CroreRs 768.22 CroreRs 290.42 CroreRs 419.28 CroreEPS34.5129.0120.018.0611.21 The standalone income statement shows that sales for March 2025 were Rs 11,431 Crore, compared to Rs 9,466 Crore for March 2024. Total income for March 2025 was Rs 12,600 Crore, compared to Rs 10,604 Crore for March 2024. Net profit was Rs 2,324 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 1,845 Crore in March 2024. The quarterly income statement shows sales of Rs 2,625 Crore for June 2025, compared to Rs 2,357 Crore for June 2024. Net profit was Rs 419 Crore for June 2025, compared to Rs 665 Crore for June 2024. The cash flow statement indicates a net cash flow of Rs 66 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 1,655 Crore in March 2024. The balance sheet shows total liabilities of Rs 27,948 Crore and total assets of Rs 27,948 Crore in March 2025, compared to total liabilities of Rs 28,776 Crore and total assets of Rs 28,776 Crore in March 2024. Sarda & Pareek LLP, Chartered Accountants as the Statutory Auditors for the FY 2025-26 on September 11, 2025. Negotiations with the Indian Navy regarding the Submarine Project P75(I) have commenced as of September 10, 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 2.71 per share (54.2%) with an effective date of September 19, 2025. Additionally, a stock split was announced on October 22, 2024, with the old face value of Rs 10 being split to a new face value of Rs 5; the ex-split and record date was December 27, 2024. title: Ashok Leyland shares rise 3.06% amid volume surge
content: Ashok Leyland shares experienced a surge of 3.06%, with the stock price reaching Rs 143.68 in Tuesday's session. The stock witnessed high volume and a notable jump in trading activity. Financial Performance: Ashok Leyland's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth. The company's revenue and net profit have steadily increased over the past few years. Quarterly Results: For the quarter-ending June 2025, Ashok Leyland reported a revenue of Rs 11,708.54 Crore and a net profit of Rs 652.98 Crore. This compares to a revenue of Rs 14,695.55 Crore and a net profit of Rs 1,234.38 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2025.ParticularsJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 10,724.49 CroreRs 11,147.58 CroreRs 11,995.21 CroreRs 14,695.55 CroreRs 11,708.54 CroreNet ProfitRs 549.53 CroreRs 755.21 CroreRs 812.09 CroreRs 1,234.38 CroreRs 652.98 CroreEPS1.732.402.593.851.04The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 11,708.54 crore, representing a decrease compared to the quarter-ending March 2025, where revenue stood at Rs 14,695.55 crore. Similarly, the net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 652.98 crore, lower than the Rs 1,234.38 crore reported for the quarter-ending March 2025. Annual Results: The annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 48,535.14 Crore, an increase from Rs 45,790.64 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 3,351.21 Crore, compared to Rs 2,679.96 Crore in the year-ending March 2024.Particulars20212022202320242025RevenueRs 19,454.10 CroreRs 26,237.15 CroreRs 41,672.60 CroreRs 45,790.64 CroreRs 48,535.14 CroreNet ProfitRs -69.10 CroreRs -292.97 CroreRs 1,350.91 CroreRs 2,679.96 CroreRs 3,351.21 CroreEPS-0.56-1.224.238.4610.58BVPS31.1029.2636.7840.2341.66ROE-2.10-4.9014.5027.5825.39Debt to Equity2.313.283.614.514.06The company's annual sales have grown from Rs 45,790 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 48,535 Crore in March 2025. The net profit has also increased from Rs 2,679 Crore to Rs 3,351 Crore during the same period. Corporate Actions: Ashok Leyland announced a change in senior management on September 20, 2025. The company also held an analyst/investor meet on September 24, 2025. The company had announced a bonus issue on May 23, 2025, with a ratio of 1:1 and a record date of July 16, 2025, with exbonus date being July 16, 2025. Dividend History: Ashok Leyland has a history of distributing dividends. title: Adani Power shares fall up to 6% on profit booking after 45% rally
content: The shares of Adani Power dropped nearly 6 percent on September 23 as investors may have resorted to profit booking at elevated levels. The stock had rallied 20 percent earlier yesterday after it turned ex-date for 1:5 stock split. The shares of the company hit an intraday low of Rs 160.25 apiece, snapping a three-day gaining streak. Earlier during the day, the stock had gained more than 1.5 percent to hit a fresh 52-week high of Rs 182.7 apiece. This implies that the stock rallied around 45 percent in just four sessions. Adani Power stock split: Adani Power's board of directors during a meeting in August had approved its first-ever stock split in the ratio of 1:5. The record date to determine the eligibility of the shareholders set to receive the bonus equity shares was set on September 22. Adani Power had earlier said that it has approved the stock split in order to “enhance the liquidity of Company's equity shares by encouraging participation of retail investors as the split will make the shares more affordable to invest”. As a result of the stock split, Adani Power shares appeared to have crashed around 80 percent, while in reality, they simply adjusted to the corporate action. Adani Group stocks have added almost $20 billion in two sessions after market regulator SEBI cleared the conglomerate and its billionaire founder Gautam Adani of stock manipulation charges levelled by US-based short-seller Hindenburg Research, Bloomberg reported. SBI Funds, Citadel Securities buy Adani Power shares from GQG, says report: SBI Funds Management and Citadel Securities LLC were among the buyers of Adani Power's shares sold by GQG Partners LLC in a $250 million deal on bourses last week, Bloomberg cited people familiar with the matter as saying. GQG Partners sold about 35 million shares, or about a 1% stake, with SBI Mutual buying most of the shares, the report added. Morgan Stanley bullish on Adani Power shares: Morgan Stanley initiated call on Adani Power with an 'overweight' rating, saying that the company is a "good illustration of turnaround in India's corporate history". This comes after market regulator SEBI cleared Gautam Adani and his diversified conglomerate of the stock manipulation charges levelled by US-based short-seller Hindenburg Research. Morgan Stanley called Adani Power its 'top pick'. "APL will deliver strong earnings growth driven by timely completion of projects & more PPA wins medium term," the international brokerage added. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Adani Power stock split: Adani Power's board of directors during a meeting in August had approved its first-ever stock split in the ratio of 1:5.
summary_luhn: SBI Funds, Citadel Securities buy Adani Power shares from GQG, says report: SBI Funds Management and Citadel Securities LLC were among the buyers of Adani Power's shares sold by GQG Partners LLC in a $250 million deal on bourses last week, Bloomberg cited people familiar with the matter as saying.
summary_lsa: This comes after market regulator SEBI cleared Gautam Adani and his diversified conglomerate of the stock manipulation charges levelled by US-based short-seller Hindenburg Research.
summary_textrank: Adani Power had earlier said that it has approved the stock split in order to “enhance the liquidity of Company's equity shares by encouraging participation of retail investors as the split will make the shares more affordable to invest”.

title: Apollo Tyres shares rise 2.19% in today's trading
content: Shares of Apollo Tyres gained 2.19% to trade at Rs 497.05 on Tuesday. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On the financial front, Apollo Tyres has demonstrated varied performance across quarterly and annual results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 6,560.76 Crore, up from Rs 6,334.85 Crore in June 2024. However, the net profit for the same period decreased significantly to Rs 12.82 Crore, compared to Rs 301.98 Crore in the previous year. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 26,123.42 Crore, an increase from Rs 25,377.72 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 1,120.65 Crore, down from Rs 1,721.51 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. Key financial figures from the consolidated income statement include:Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 26,123 CroreRs 25,377 CroreRs 24,568 CroreRs 20,947 CroreRs 17,397 CroreOther IncomeRs 88 CroreRs 153 CroreRs 41 CroreRs 123 CroreRs 129 CroreTotal IncomeRs 26,211 CroreRs 25,531 CroreRs 24,609 CroreRs 21,071 CroreRs 17,526 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 24,218 CroreRs 22,485 CroreRs 22,651 CroreRs 19,779 CroreRs 16,522 CroreEBITRs 1,992 CroreRs 3,045 CroreRs 1,958 CroreRs 1,291 CroreRs 1,004 CroreInterestRs 446 CroreRs 505 CroreRs 531 CroreRs 444 CroreRs 442 CroreTaxRs 425 CroreRs 818 CroreRs 322 CroreRs 209 CroreRs 211 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,120 CroreRs 1,721 CroreRs 1,104 CroreRs 638 CroreRs 350 CroreThe company’s cash flow from operating activities for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 1,823 Crore, compared to Rs 3,439 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. The balance sheet shows that the company’s total assets were Rs 27,306 Crore as of March 2025, compared to Rs 26,957 Crore as of March 2024. Key ratios include a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.23 as of March 2025, and a current ratio of 1.33. Apollo Tyres announced a final dividend of Rs 5 per share on May 14, 2025, which was effective from July 11, 2025. The company had earlier announced a stock split on May 1, 2007, with the ex-split date being August 17, 2007. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment on the stock as of September 23, 2025.

title: Subscribe for Seshaasai Technologies Ltd IPO; Anand Rathi
content: Anand Rathi, Seshaasai Technologies Ltd Seshaasai Technologies Limited is a technology-driven multi-location solutions provider focused on offering payments solutions, and communications and fulfilment solutions catering primarily to the banking, financial services and insurance (“BFSI”) industry, with data security, and compliance at the core of their solutions. Solutions that they offer at scale and on a recurring basis, driven by their proprietary platforms, play a crucial role in enabling the operations and deliverables of the BFSI sector in India. They also offer Internet of Things (“IoT”) solutions to a diverse set of customers across industries. They are one of the top two payments card manufacturers in India with a market share of 31.9% in Fiscal 2025 for credit and debit cards issuance in India, improving from 25.0% in Fiscal 2023. They are one of the largest manufacturers of cheque leaves in India. Valuation and Outlook Additionally, they plan to expand their offerings internationally, targeting the SAARC region, parts of Africa, and Eastern Europe. Considering these factors, the IPO appears fully priced and merits a “SUBSCRIBE – LONG TERM” recommendation. title: Subscribe for Solarworld Energy Solutions Ltd IPO; Anand Rathi
content: Anand Rathi, Solarworld Energy Solutions Ltd Incorporated in 2013, Solarworld Energy Solutions Ltd operates in the solar energy sector, specializing in engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) services for solar power projects. Established in 2013, it provides comprehensive, end-to-end solutions tailored to public sector undertakings (PSUs) and commercial and industrial (C&I) clients. The company’s operational capabilities are demonstrated by its portfolio of projects, including completed projects with an aggregate capacity of 253.67 MW AC (336.17 MW DC) and ongoing projects with capacities of 765 MW AC (994 MW DC) for EPC services, alongside 325 MW / 650 MWh for battery energy storage systems (BESS) as of July 31, 2025. Valuation and Outlook The company operates within a highly competitive and fragmented market landscape. The growth of the solar sector in India is predominantly driven by strong government support, evidenced by an aggressive and sustained tendering approach therefore company would capitalize profitability in long run. Hence, we assign Subscribe for long term rating for the issue. The company announced acquisition under Regulation 30 (LODR) on September 19, 2025. The company also intimated about setting up a new manufacturing site by PT Godrej Consumer Products Indonesia on September 8, 2025. The company has announced multiple interim dividends. On July 31, 2025, a dividend of Rs 5 per share was announced, with the effective date being August 13, 2025. Earlier, on April 21, 2025, and January 8, 2025, similar interim dividends were declared. Godrej Consumer Products had announced a bonus issue on July 30, 2018, with a bonus ratio of 1:2, and the ex-bonus date was September 12, 2018. Prior to that, another bonus issue was announced on May 9, 2017, with a ratio of 1:1, and the ex-bonus date was June 22, 2017. The company had announced rights issue on November 23, 2007, with rights ratio of 1:7 and exrights date was March 12, 2008. The company also had a stock split on April 26, 2006, with the ex-split date being August 24, 2006. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,206.20, Godrej Consumer Products has seen a decline of 2.11% in today's session.

title: Buy Indian Metals and Ferro Alloys; target of Rs 1510: Anand Rathi
content: Anand Rathi's research report on Indian Metals and Ferro Alloys The largest fully integrated value-added ferrochrome producer in India, IMFA is raising production capacity ~35%, from ~284,000 tonnes to ~384,000 with a greenfield ferrochrome plant at Kalinganagar expected by mid CY26. It has received in-principle approval to expand capacity a further ~200,000 tonnes. To support expanded operations, environmental clearance for its captive chrome ore mines at Sukinda and Mahagiri has been raised to 1.2m tonnes, with ore raising of 0.9m tonnes expected by FY28 and 1.2m by FY31 (PRC). Besides, levering the available land bank and bulk raw material handling infrastructure at Therubali, it is setting up a 120kL/day ethanol plant. This value-accretive diversification is expected to generate ~Rs3bn revenue yearly with an 8-10% EBITDA margin. >80% of demand for ferro-chrome, a key ingredient in stainless steel production, is driven by the industry. Demand in India for ferrochrome is expected to rise further as stainless steel consumption grows, backed by urbanisation, government initiatives to boost manufacturing and infrastructure, and greater demand from automotives, railways, etc. Outlook Considering IMFA’s fully integrated operations, ~0.1x leverage and high-teen return ratios, we initiate coverage with a Buy rating and a sum-of-parts TP of Rs1,510. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Indian Metals and Ferro Alloys - 23 - 09 - 2025 - anand
summary_lexrank: Anand Rathi's research report on Indian Metals and Ferro Alloys The largest fully integrated value-added ferrochrome producer in India, IMFA is raising production capacity ~35%, from ~284,000 tonnes to ~384,000 with a greenfield ferrochrome plant at Kalinganagar expected by mid CY26.
summary_luhn: Anand Rathi's research report on Indian Metals and Ferro Alloys The largest fully integrated value-added ferrochrome producer in India, IMFA is raising production capacity ~35%, from ~284,000 tonnes to ~384,000 with a greenfield ferrochrome plant at Kalinganagar expected by mid CY26.
summary_lsa: Besides, levering the available land bank and bulk raw material handling infrastructure at Therubali, it is setting up a 120kL/day ethanol plant.

title: Buy AGI Greenpac; target of Rs 1520: Emkay Global Financial
content: Emkay Global Financial' research report on AGI Greenpac The CG sector has, in the last 15 years, seen multiple ebbs and flows—demand volatility, overcapacity, and input-fuel cost spikes—with several players including erstwhile market leader HNGIL being left bankrupt; however, AGI with its innovative products and processes, cost efficiencies, and disciplined capital allocation clocked 13% revenue/15% EBITDA CAGR with a current return profile of ~15%. The Indian CG sector outlook is steady, with 4-5% volume/8- 9% value CAGR amid key user industries like AlcoBev, Food & Beverage (F&B), and pharma growing healthily while the input cost environment is benign, with soda ash and energy costs well-contained. AGI is expanding glass capacity by 30% to ~2,600tpd by FY27-end with a new Rs7bn plant in Madhya Pradesh, while also diversifying into the aluminium can segment (1.6bn capacity by CY30; Rs10bn capex), which is a fast-growing (15% CAGR), 2-player market in India currently. AGI also has smaller caps & closures and PET bottle businesses, which should grow in double digits on a low base. We estimate 17% revenue/29% APAT CAGR during FY25-28E with RoE/RoCE improving to 19% by FY28E. FY26-27 would be the capex phase, followed by healthy FCF generation, with 2% yield in FY28E and growth thereafter. Outlook We initiate coverage on AGI Greenpac (AGI) with BUY and Sep-26E TP of Rs1,520 based on DCF method, implying 19x Sep-27E EPS. AGI is a leader in the Indian container glass (CG) industry with >20% market share. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. AGI Greenpac - 23 - 09 - 2025 - emkay

title: Maruti Suzuki India shares rise 1.59% in Tuesday's trade
content: Shares of Maruti Suzuki India were trading with a gain of 1.59% at Rs 16,068.00 on the NSE at 12:00 pm. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. On the financial front, Maruti Suzuki India has demonstrated steady growth in both quarterly and annual results. The company's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 38,605.20 Crore, compared to Rs 35,779.40 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 3,756.90 Crore, up from Rs 3,702.10 Crore. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) also increased from Rs 119.58 to Rs 120.62. The annual consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 152,913.00 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 141,858.20 Crore in the previous year. The net profit rose to Rs 14,256.30 Crore from Rs 13,234.10 Crore, and the EPS increased to Rs 461.20 from Rs 429.01. The company has also consistently increased its dividend payout, with a final dividend of Rs 135.00 per share declared on April 25, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment on the stock as of September 23, 2025. Maruti Suzuki India Limited has been actively informing the Exchange about various corporate developments, including Intimations under Regulation 30 of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 and schedules of meetings. The stock's last traded price was Rs 16,068.00, with positive investor sentiment driving its current gains.

title: Subscribe for Solarworld Energy Solutions Ltd IPO; Ajcon Global
content: Ajcon Global, Solarworld Energy Solutions Ltd Solarworld Energy Solutions Ltd. (SESL) is a solar energy solutions provider that specializes in engineering, procurement, and construction ("EPC") services for solar power projects. It began operations in 2013 and provides complete, end-toend, and cost-effective solutions for the installation of solar power projects adapted to the demands of customers, including public sector undertakings ("PSUs") and commercial and industrial clients ("C&I Clients"). SESL's business operations are supported by strong execution skills, as evidenced by projects that have reached their commercial operation date ("Completed Projects") and those for which it has received orders or is actively executing ("Ongoing Projects"). As of July 31, 2025, it had completed projects with a total capacity of 253.67 megawatts ("MW") AC/ 336.17 MW DC, and ongoing projects with capacities of 765 MW AC/ 994 MW DC for EPC and 325 MW/650 MWh for BESS. Valuation and Outlook Having executed 46 projects across 9 states for marquee clients like SJVN Green Energy, Haldiram Snacks, and Ethnic Foods, SESL has established strong presence in both PSU and private sectors. At the upper price band of ₹351, the issue is valued at a P/E multiple of about 39.48x on its FY25 post-IPO EPS of ₹8.89. We give a ‘SUBSCRIBE’ rating to the issue for the following reasons. title: Subscribe for Seshasaai Technologies Ltd IPO; Ajcon Global
content: Ajcon Global, Seshasaai Technologies Ltd Seshasaai Technologies Limited (“Seshasaai”) is a technology-driven, multilocation solutions provider offering payments, communications, fulfilment, and IoT solutions, with a strong focus on the banking, financial services, and insurance (BFSI) sector. Data security and compliance lie at the core of its operations, and its proprietary platforms enable delivery at scale on a recurring basis. The company plays a critical role in supporting BFSI operations in India and is also one of the top two payment card manufacturers in the country with a market share of 31.9% in FY25, up from 25.0% in FY23. In addition, Seshasaai is one of the largest cheque leaf manufacturers in India and has diversified into Internet of Things (IoT) solutions catering to multiple industries. Valuation and Outlook As digital payments, secure communication, and IoT adoption accelerate in India’s BFSI sector, Seshasaai Technologies has emerged as a leading player, offering scalable, compliant, and technology-driven solutions across payments, communications, fulfilment, and IoT, supported by a pan-India manufacturing and service network. title: Adani Total Gas, MphasiS stocks among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Adani Total Gas, MphasiS, and Aditya Birla Fashion were among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 at 11:00 am on Tuesday. Adani Total Gas shares declined 4.23% to Rs 747.75. MphasiS shares fell 2.83% to Rs 2,771.80. Aditya Birla Fashion shares dropped 2.44% to Rs 91.20. BSE Limited shares also saw a decline, falling 2.42% to Rs 2,104. title: AU Small Finance, Vodafone Idea stocks among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: At 11:00 am on Tuesday, several stocks were noted as top gainers within the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Among these were AU Small Finance, Vodafone Idea, Ashok Leyland, NLC India, and Thermax. AU Small Finance: AU Small Finance shares showed a gain, with the stock trading at Rs 725.55, up 2.76%. Vodafone Idea: Vodafone Idea also saw a positive movement, trading at Rs 8.58, which is a 2.26% increase. Ashok Leyland: Ashok Leyland shares were trading higher at Rs 142.34, reflecting a rise of 2.09%. NLC India: NLC India shares also registered a gain, trading at Rs 269.77, which is also a 2.09% increase. Thermax: Thermax shares were up, trading at Rs 3,328.00 with a 1.78% increase. These stocks were identified as top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index during morning trade. According to a Moneycontrol analysis from September 16, 2025, market sentiment is bearish. title: Aditya Birla Fashion shares fall 2.06%; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Aditya Birla Fashion declined by 2.06% to Rs 91.55 in Tuesday's trading session, making it among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. At 10:58 am, the stock was trading lower compared to its previous close. Aditya Birla Fashion is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty Midcap 150 index. The consolidated financial performance of Aditya Birla Fashion shows varied results. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,831.46 Crore, while the net loss was Rs 227.98 Crore, and the EPS was reported at -Rs 1.74. title: Buy Belrise Industries; target of Rs 192: LKP Research
content: LKP Research's research report on Belrise Industries The Pune based company Belrise Industries Limited (Belrise), primarily a 2W auto ancillary with largely powertrain agnostic products, is well placed for growth as it is adding OEMs and establishing new ties. The company is rolling out new products and improving CPV via premiumization. The company’s 4W business (9% of topline in FY25) also should see a strong escalation on the back of strong order-book, improved technological capabilities through H-One acquisition, entry into Japanese OEMs and fresh ties with a leading Japanese PV OEM to reach 12-13% of topline by FY28. We believe increase in 4W share shall further improve the CPV and lead to re-rating of the stock. We anticipate Belrise to deliver ~34% PAT CAGR over FY25-28E as operating performance (13% EBITDA CAGR) is multiplied by de-leveraging impact. Outlook The planned and proposed transfer of related party entities should simplify group structure and thus be value accretive, adding to re-rating levers. Any occurrence of hiving off or reduction in the low margin Trading business would further drive profitability of the stock. We initiate with a BUY. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Belrise Industries - 23 - 09 - 2025 - lkp

title: Buyl AU Small Finance Bank; target of Rs 875: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on AU Small Finance Bank AU Small Finance Bank (AUBANK) remains an attractive combination of growth and earnings as the bank navigates through the last leg of stress in the MFI and Cards segments. The recovery in credit cost, margins, and loan growth (led by festival demand and GST cuts) will aid earnings, while the transition to a universal bank provides a strong runway for growth. Deposit mobilization continues to remain healthy, with stable deposits forming ~79% of the total deposits. During 1QFY26, NIM contracted sharply to 5.4% but is expected to bottom out in 2Q and recover thereafter. AUBANK’s GNPA rose 19bp QoQ to 2.47% in 1QFY26; however, it expects stress to peak in 2Q. The bank has incurred 34bp of credit costs in 1Q, and we estimate 2Q credit costs to be ~30bp. This implies a sharp deceleration in provisioning expenses during 2H as management maintains its full-year guidance of 100bp. Outlook We estimate AUBANK to deliver 24% loan CAGR over FY26-28, which, coupled with improvement in operating metrics, will enable a 33% earnings CAGR. The recent correction in stock price has made the risk-reward favorable. Hence, we reiterate our BUY rating on the stock with an unchanged TP of INR875 (based on 2.8x FY27E BV). title: Buyl Tata Consumer Products; target of Rs 1300: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Tata Consumer Products In FY25, India’s tea production declined 5% YoY but rebounded in the current season (Jan– Jul’25) with 14% growth, led by Assam and West Bengal. This stabilized prices after a peak in Jun’25. The Indian tea business remained resilient, with pricing actions partly offsetting cost pressures; margins contracted in 1QFY26 but are expected to improve from 2Q as production improves and prices stabilize. Alongside, the company is expanding its health & wellness portfolio, premiumizing its tea product portfolio in the domestic market, and maintaining ecommerce leadership. In this note, we have analyzed tea prices and production trends and their impact on Tata Consumer Products (TATACONS). Outlook We expect TATACONS to clock a revenue/EBITDA/PAT CAGR of 10%/12%/13% during FY25-27. We reiterate our BUY rating with an SoTP-based TP of INR1,300. title: Maruti Suzuki India shares gain 2.20%, among top gainers on Nifty 50 today
content: Maruti Suzuki India shares rose by 2.20% to trade at Rs 16,164 at about 10:40 am. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index, and was among its top gainers in the morning trade. Financial Snapshot: Maruti Suzuki India's consolidated financial performance reveals the following trends: Quarterly Performance: For the quarter-ending June 2025, the company reported revenue of Rs 38,605.20 Crore and a net profit of Rs 3,756.90 Crore. This compares to revenue of Rs 40,920.10 Crore and a net profit of Rs 3,839.20 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The EPS for June 2025 stood at Rs 120.62, slightly lower than the Rs 124.40 reported in March 2025. A comparison of quarterly revenues shows that revenue decreased by 5.66% from March 2025 (Rs 40,920.10 crore) to June 2025 (Rs 38,605.20 crore). Similarly, net profit decreased by 2.14% from Rs 3,839.20 crore in March 2025 to Rs 3,756.90 crore in June 2025. Annual Performance: The company's annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 152,913.00 Crore, with a net profit of Rs 14,256.30 Crore and EPS of Rs 461.20. This compares to the year-ending March 2024, where revenue was Rs 141,858.20 Crore, net profit was Rs 13,234.10 Crore, and EPS was Rs 429.01. Year-over-year, the revenue increased by 7.79% from Rs 141,858.20 crore in March 2024 to Rs 152,913.00 crore in March 2025. The net profit also increased by 7.72% from Rs 13,234.10 crore to Rs 14,256.30 crore during the same period. title: Trent, Asian Paints stocks among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Indian markets saw Trent, Asian Paints, and UltraTech Cement among the top losers on the Nifty 50 in Tuesday's trading session. At 10:30 am, Trent was trading at Rs 4,873.50, down 2.73%; Asian Paints at Rs 2,434.30, down 1.95%; and UltraTech Cement at Rs 12,473.00, a fall of 1.4% from its previous close. Trent Financial Overview: Trent's consolidated quarterly revenue shows an increase in the recent period. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 4,883.48 Crore, up from Rs 4,104.44 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period rose to Rs 415.49 Crore from Rs 335.61 Crore. The company’s EPS stood at Rs 12.09 in June 2025, compared to Rs 11.04 in June 2024. The company's consolidated yearly revenue also reflects growth, with Rs 17,134.61 Crore reported in March 2025, compared to Rs 12,375.11 Crore in March 2024. Net profit increased to Rs 1,447.91 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 1,353.89 Crore in March 2024. The EPS increased to Rs 43.51 in March 2025 from Rs 41.82 in March 2024. Key financial ratios for Trent show a P/E ratio of 122.39 and a P/B ratio of 34.57. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.09 as of the year-ending March 2025. The following table summarizes Trent's key financial data:ParticularsMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025Revenue (Rs Crore)Rs 2,592.96 CroreRs 4,498.02 CroreRs 8,242.02 CroreRs 12,375.11 CroreRs 17,134.61 CroreNet Profit (Rs Crore)-109.77 CroreRs 29.46 CroreRs 310.22 CroreRs 1,353.89 CroreRs 1,447.91 CroreEPS-4.112.9812.5141.8243.51BVPS66.3267.7974.91115.40153.64ROE-6.314.4717.1336.5528.31Debt to Equity0.000.210.190.120.09Asian Paints Financial Overview: Asian Paints' consolidated quarterly revenue was Rs 8,938.55 Crore for June 2025, slightly down from Rs 8,969.73 Crore in June 2024. Net profit decreased to Rs 1,080.73 Crore from Rs 1,150.07 Crore. The company’s EPS stood at Rs 11.47 in June 2025, compared to Rs 12.20 in June 2024. The company's consolidated yearly revenue decreased to Rs 33,905.62 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 35,494.73 Crore in March 2024. Net profit decreased to Rs 3,569.00 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 5,424.69 Crore in March 2024. The EPS decreased to Rs 38.25 in March 2025 from Rs 56.95 in March 2024. Key financial ratios for Asian Paints show a P/E ratio of 61.19 and a P/B ratio of 11.56. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.04 as of the year-ending March 2025. Net profit increased to Rs 2,225.22 Crore from Rs 1,692.33 Crore. The company’s EPS stood at Rs 75.67 in June 2025, compared to Rs 58.87 in June 2024. The company's consolidated yearly revenue increased to Rs 75,955.13 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 70,908.14 Crore in March 2024. Net profit decreased to Rs 6,050.21 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 6,981.95 Crore in March 2024. The EPS decreased to Rs 205.30 in March 2025 from Rs 243.05 in March 2024. Key financial ratios for UltraTech Cement show a P/E ratio of 56.06 and a P/B ratio of 4.79. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.33 as of the year-ending March 2025. The following table summarizes UltraTech Cement's key financial data:ParticularsMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025Revenue (Rs Crore)Rs 44,725.80 CroreRs 52,598.83 CroreRs 63,239.98 CroreRs 70,908.14 CroreRs 75,955.13 CroreNet Profit (Rs Crore)Rs 5,316.76 CroreRs 7,265.14 CroreRs 5,069.37 CroreRs 6,981.95 CroreRs 6,050.21 CroreEPS189.40254.64175.63243.05205.30BVPS1,530.591,747.051,883.692,086.232,399.42ROE12.3614.569.3211.638.54Debt to Equity0.400.200.180.170.33Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bearish sentiment as of today. The trading window for Trent is closed from September 24, 2025, until 48 hours after the declaration of unaudited financial results for the quarter/half year ending September 30, 2025. Trent’s board has announced a final dividend of Rs 5.00 per share. The ex-date for this dividend is June 12, 2025. The company had a stock split on September 12, 2016. Previous bonus issues include a 1:1 bonus on October 22, 1996. Asian Paints board announced a final dividend of Rs 20.55 per share, with the ex-date being June 10, 2025. The company had a stock split on July 30, 2013. UltraTech Cement’s board has announced a final dividend of Rs 77.50 per share, with the ex-date being July 25, 2025. Tech Mahindra board announced a final dividend of Rs 30.00 per share, with the ex-date being July 4, 2025. The company had a stock split on March 19, 2015. A previous bonus issue of 1:1 was announced on June 23, 2011. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bearish sentiment as of today.

title: AWL Agri Business shares fall 2.10%; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of AWL Agri Business experienced a decline of 2.10% to Rs 265.40 during Tuesday's trading session, at 10:34 am. The stock was among the top losers within the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financials: The consolidated revenue for AWL Agri Business has shown variability over the past year. The quarterly revenue increased from Rs 14,168.58 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 17,058.65 Crore in June 2025. Net profit also fluctuated, decreasing from Rs 311.63 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 231.77 Crore in June 2025. The following table provides a detailed overview of the company's consolidated quarterly financials:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 14,168.58 CroreRs 14,460.45 CroreRs 16,859.31 CroreRs 18,229.59 CroreRs 17,058.65 CroreNet ProfitRs 311.63 CroreRs 281.92 CroreRs 393.16 CroreRs 176.52 CroreRs 231.77 CroreEPS2.412.393.161.471.84AWL Agri Business's consolidated yearly financials also indicate a fluctuating trend. Revenue increased from Rs 54,213.55 Crore in 2022 to Rs 63,672.24 Crore in 2025. Net profit also demonstrated variability, increasing from Rs 774.35 Crore in 2022 to Rs 1,163.23 Crore in 2025. Interest expenses decreased from Rs 728 Crore in March 2023 to Rs 525 Crore in March 2022. The standalone quarterly income statement also reflects variability. Sales decreased from Rs 16,490 Crore in December 2024 to Rs 13,750 Crore in June 2024. Similarly, net profit decreased from Rs 409 Crore in December 2024 to Rs 323 Crore in June 2024. Key financial ratios for AWL Agri Business indicate a mixed performance. As of March 2025, the debt-to-equity ratio was 0.74. The basic and diluted EPS were both reported as Rs 9.36 as of March 2025. Shares of AWL Agri Business were trading lower at Rs 265.40, down by 2.10% in today's session.

title: Maruti Suzuki, Eicher Motors stocks among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: At 10:30 am, Maruti Suzuki and Eicher Motors shares emerged as top gainers on Nifty 50. Maruti Suzuki stock was trading at Rs 16,150.00, a 2.11% increase from the previous close. Eicher Motors was trading at Rs 7,062.50, up by 1.68%. Bajaj Finance also saw a gain of 1.56%, trading at Rs 1,022.20. M&M and Tata Motors recorded gains of 1.24% and 0.67% respectively.Maruti Suzuki Financial PerformanceMaruti Suzuki's financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the years. The company's consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 152,913.00 Crore, up from Rs 141,858.20 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period was Rs 14,256.30 Crore, compared to Rs 13,234.10 Crore in the previous year. The earnings per share (EPS) also increased from Rs 429.01 to Rs 461.20. title: Bharti Airtel shares decline 0.81% in today's session; over 6.7 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading lower in Tuesday's session, with the stock priced at Rs 1,940.40, a decline of 0.81% from the previous close, at 10:20 am. Over 6.7 lakh shares changed hands in the current trading session. In terms of financial performance, Bharti Airtel has shown consistent growth in revenue over the past few years. The company's consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 172,985.20 Crore, up from Rs 149,982.40 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also saw a significant increase, reaching Rs 33,778.30 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 5,848.60 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. Here is a summary of Bharti Airtel's key financial figures:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)2021100,615.80-23,327.90-27.652022116,546.905,882.007.672023139,144.8011,535.3014.802024149,982.405,848.6013.092025172,985.2033,778.3058.00The company’s quarterly performance also reflects positive trends. For the quarter-ending June 2025, Bharti Airtel's revenue stood at Rs 49,462.60 Crore, up from Rs 38,506.40 Crore in the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 7,339.00 Crore, compared to Rs 3,805.80 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. Here is a summary of Bharti Airtel's key quarterly financial figures:QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 202438,506.403,805.807.21Sep 202441,473.303,079.506.21Dec 202445,129.3014,474.9025.54Mar 202547,876.2012,418.1019.02Jun 202549,462.607,339.0010.26Bharti Airtel has consistently increased its dividend payout over the years. The final dividend for the year 2025 was Rs 16.00 per share, compared to Rs 8.00 per share in 2024. Bharti Airtel announced on September 17, 2025, that it would be holding an analyst/investor meet, as disclosed under Regulation 30 of SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements), Regulations, 2015. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,940.40, Bharti Airtel has seen a decline of 0.81% from the previous close.

title: Neutral TATA Steel; target of Rs 180: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on TATA Steel Tata Steel (TATA) is pursuing an aggressive capacity expansion strategy in India to capitalize on the rising domestic demand. The company has outlined a target to double its crude steel capacity from the current 21.6MTPA to 40MTPA by FY30, with an annual capex commitment of ~INR100b. TATA commissioned India’s largest BF at Kalinganagar in FY25, increasing the capacity from 3MTPA to 8MTPA, backed by an investment of INR270b. The capacity ramp-up is currently on track and in phase-II of expansion. Management aims to increase the capacity by another 5MTPA, bringing the total to 13MTPA. Other initiatives include scaling Neelachal Ispat Nigam Ltd (NINL) from 1MTPA to 5.5MTPA, and commissioning a 0.75MTPA scrapbased electric arc furnace in Ludhiana by 2026. The company also plans to expand the Meramandali unit from 5 MTPA to 6.5 MTPA, aligning with broader capacity goals. Outlook At CMP, TATA is trading at 7.6x EV/EBITDA and 4.1x FY27E P/B. We believe that all the positives are well priced in. We reiterate our Neutral rating with an SOTP-based TP of INR180 per share on FY27 estimate. title: Auto shares in the fast lane on festive demand, Maruti hits 52-week high on Goldman Sachs' Buy call
content: Signs of robust demand for two and four-wheelers have spurred shares of automotive companies, with the Nifty Auto index rising by nearly 1.5 percent on September 23, led by Maruti, Eicher, Tata Motors, M&M and Hero Moto along with consumer loan NBFC Bajaj Finance, thus cushioning the broader market weakness. Among F&O names, Ashok Leyland, Bajaj Auto, TVS Motor and Bharat Forge joined the ranks of top gainers. The momentum has ensured that all components of the Auto index were trading higher, barring one. Over the last 30 days, shares of ancillary players such as Motherson Sumi and Bharat Forge are higher between 10-15 percent, in ancitipation of the ruboff to their businesses. Early trends and dealer channel checks have showed that the first day of the festive sales during the ongoing Navratri season have seen a healthy demand, with Maruti, Tata Motors and Hyundai Motor India posting strong bookings following a subdued September due the Shradhh period during which fresh purchases are typically deferred. Brokerages Bullish Adding the momentum for Maruti was a bullish note by Goldman Sachs that has upgraded the stock Buy from Neutral with a target of Rs 18,900 per share, sending the shares to a 52-week high. In a separate note, Nuvama said the demand upcycle in the passenger car segment could continue up to FY29, helped by GST 2.0 with healthy demand expected across two-wheelers, tractors, and PVs. "PV is at a mid to advanced stage of the upcycle. Average/maximum duration of upcycle as per historical data is six/eight years; hence, upcycle can continue up to FY27/FY29," said the Nuvama note. The brokerage attributed the momentum in automotive companies to GST cuts, new launches, the anticipation of benefit from the upcoming pay commission recommendation for government employees and hopes of another RBI rate cuts this year. Nuvama cited historical data that suggested upcycles lasting between 6-8 years to suggest that the current cycle in 2Ws could continue till FY30. Emkay Global quoted an automotive dealer from Western India who said that the tide may be turning for passenger cars after nearly two years of subdued growth. It quoted a 15-20% on year growth in bookings across segments so far in September for the region. The volume growth for October-December period is expected to over 20 percent, the dealer added. The automotive dealer told Emkay that the demand for electric 2Ws is expected to sustain even after the price gap with ICE bikes has narrowed following the GST cut, and said customers are willing to pay a premium for differentiated offerings. Trucks are seeing more value growth than volume growth as fleet operators are choosing to shift to higher tonnage vehicles to improve utilization, the dealer told Emkay Global. Read More: Maruti Suzuki's sharp price cuts may hit margin by 100 bps near term: Nomura Carmakers See Strong Demand Tata Motors has recorded 10,000 deliveries and over 25,000 enquiries on the first day of Navratri, in a sign of strong demand on the first day of the festive season. The management of Maruti said the company has had close to 30,000 bookings and 80,000 enquiries were registered on the first day of Navratri. Hyundai Motor India said the company recorded 11,000 dealer billings on September 22, marking its best day in five years. The management said it sees the demand sustaining ahead. Maruti has further extended the passthrough of GST benefits by cutting prices of entry-level hatchbacks in a strategic manner in an attempt to revive the small car segment. Maruti's current discount schemes are expected to continue till the end of September, over and above the price cuts. Tarun Garg, Whole-Time Director and COO of Hyundai Motor India said, "The auspicious start of Navratri, amplified by the momentum from GST 2.0 reforms, has infused strong positivity into the market. On Day 1 alone, Hyundai Motor India Limited recorded around 11,000 Dealer billings, which is our highest single-day performance in the last five years". The robust sentiment and customer confidence has prompted Hyundai to anticipate that the demand is expected to sustain. Tata Motors had in August said that it is 'hopeful' of the festive demand extending till December 2025, as was the trend during the last financial year. All segments of cars ranging from hatchbacks to luxury SUVs have become cheaper, with customers standing to save between Rs 40,000 and Rs 30 lakh on ex-showroom prices. title: Asian stocks primed for best year against US peers since 2017
content: Asian stocks will likely keep eclipsing their US peers, as a weaker dollar further raises the appeal of a region that has benefited from cheaper valuations and a momentous shift away from American assets, according to analysts. Also supporting the region’s equities are growing signs of easing trade tensions, especially between the US and China, where a months-long rally looks far from over. While the Federal Reserve’s latest interest rate cut was a given, it reinforced a bearish outlook for the US currency and opened up space for Asian central banks to loosen policy. The MSCI Asia Pacific Index has climbed 22% this year, beating the S&P 500 Index by around eight percentage points and set for the biggest annual outperformance since 2017. “We are tactically constructive on APAC equities’ relative performance in the remainder of the year versus US equities,” said Homin Lee, a senior macro strategist at Lombard Odier Singapore Ltd. A confluence of factors, from stable commodity prices to lower US rates and fading trade disruption should provide a decent backdrop for the markets, he added. The MSCI Asia gauge is trading at 16 times forward earnings estimates, below the S&P 500’s 23 times. Meanwhile, the Hang Seng Tech Index that jumped to a four-year high last week trades at around 21 times forward earnings, versus 27 times for the Nasdaq 100 Index, according to Bloomberg-compiled data. While the speed and magnitude of the Fed’s policy easing cycle remains uncertain, its rate cut last week was an extra boost to Asian currencies. Signals from the options market suggest traders are paying a premium to hedge against further strength in Asian currencies. Aggregates of risk reversals in the region, a measure of demand for options that pay out if the currencies strengthen against the dollar over various periods, have been in positive territory for months. “Given this backdrop we are increasing our exposure to non-US equities including Asian equities relative to US equities,” said Chang Hwan Sung, a multi-asset portfolio manager in Invesco’s investment solutions team in Hong Kong. The preference is mainly driven by a bearish view on the greenback and “US capital outflows seeking international diversification and foreign currency appreciation,” he added. To be sure, any inflation-driven pause on the Fed’s rate-cut cycle or even a hawkish policy pivot would easily reverse investor sentiment, while the US-China ties remain vulnerable to deterioration. Meantime, political uncertainties in Indonesia, Thailand and Japan are also in focus. But for now, there’s optimism that as US exceptionalism continues to draw skeptics, the appetite for Asian stocks will likely stay strong. “The U.S. remains the center of gravity for AI and corporate earnings power, but Asia offers distinct angles,” said Charu Chanana, chief investment strategist at Saxo Markets, citing “India’s domestic demand story, Japan’s banks amid Bank of Japan tightening, and selective China tech plays where policy support and monetization are starting to align.”
summary_lexrank: “We are tactically constructive on APAC equities’ relative performance in the remainder of the year versus US equities,” said Homin Lee, a senior macro strategist at Lombard Odier Singapore Ltd. A confluence of factors, from stable commodity prices to lower US rates and fading trade disruption should provide a decent backdrop for the markets, he added.

A confluence of factors, from stable commodity prices to lower US rates and fading trade disruption should provide a decent backdrop for the markets, he added.
